results.title: From here to there
results.brief_description: This film shows an aeroplane trip from Los Angeles to New York. Points out the excitement and the poignancy of partings and greetings and the unique visual experience of flying. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Childhood: the enchanted years
results.brief_description: An introduction to the study of the physical and mental development of the child from birth to four years of age is presented in this film. Shows how children learn to reach, perceive, walk and talk. Of particular interest are the simple perceptual experiments which show the reactions of the psychological mechanisms of the child.

results.title: Abstract designs from nature with Edward Betts
results.brief_description: Observes Edward Betts as he makes several pencil drawings at a quarry. Shows how he develops one of his drawings into a watercolour in his studio.

results.title: The Durango Daredevil strikes again: bullying
results.brief_description: Shows the negative result of intimidation and the undesirability of such actions. Shows how Butch Bear dresses up like his hero, the Durango Daredevil, and terrorises his puppet friends because they won’t let him play piano in the school concert. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Safety in the shop: hand tools
results.creator_credit: David Thompson, Mary Thompson, Coronet Films and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the value in both wood and metal shops of keeping hand tools in good condition, the need to keep saws and chisels sharp, and possible dangers from broken handles, worn tips and burrs. Emphasises the importance of protective clothing, and demonstrates safe use of the forge and welding equipment.

results.title: Speed of chemical change
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Iwanama Productions
results.brief_description: This film discusses the factors that affect the speed of a chemical change. Models are used to illustrate the action of oxygen on carbon to produce carbon dioxide. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Gravity, weight & weightlessness
results.brief_description: Defines weight as the measure of the pull of gravity. Shows how space scientists are studying gravity, weight and the effects of free fall and weightlessness, in order to launch satellites into orbit.

results.title: The Environment: garbage
results.brief_description: Uses a montage of garbage cans, music and images, with no narration, to reveal the many kinds of garbage and the need to be aware of the problem. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Asteroids, comets and meteorites
results.creator_credit: Herbert Schick and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: This film opens with pictures of man-made satellites and proceeds to show the characteristics of the minor members of the solar system - asteroids, comets and meteorites. Animated diagrams show the ways meteorites, comets and asteroids move in the system. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Hospital at work
results.creator_credit: John Gray, Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media Australia
results.brief_description: When Michelle is admitted to hospital to have her tonsils removed, she is treated with kindness and sympathy. A doctor reassuringly explains what will happen in the operating theatre. Also shown are other areas of the hospital, and other activities and equipment. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Gray, Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media Australia
